characters.name: Adagio Dazzle
characters.description: Adagio Dazzle is a female siren and one of the main antagonists in My Little Pony Equestria Girls: Rainbow Rocks. She is the lead singer of her band the Dazzlings, rivaling the Rainbooms.

characters.name: Ahuizotl
characters.description: Ahuizotl ( /æwiˈzoʊtəl/ a-wee-ZOH-tuhl) is a male character who first appears in the Daring Do book series in the episode Read It and Weep, physically appears in Daring Don't and Daring Doubt, and also appears in the chapter book Daring Do and the Eternal Flower and the IDW comics. He is the archenemy of the book series' main character and writer Daring Do.

characters.name: Allie
characters.description: An alligator who grew up together with Mage Meadowbrook and learned how to speak from her in My Little Pony: Legends of Magic Issue #8.

characters.name: Aria Blaze
characters.description: Aria Blaze is a female siren and one of the main antagonists in My Little Pony Equestria Girls: Rainbow Rocks. She is a backup singer in her band the Dazzlings, rivaling the Rainbooms.

characters.name: Arimaspi
characters.description: A monster who stole the Idol of Boreas and fell into Griffonstone's Abysmal Abyss, directly leading to Griffonstone's decline. His skull appears in Fundamentals of Magic episode 4.

characters.name: Big Boy
characters.description: Big Boy and Runt are two gremlins who first appear in My Little Pony Micro-Series Issue #2 as antagonists and later cameo in other IDW comics. They are referred to only as gremlins in their debut issue and as cloud gremlins in the publicity summary of the issue, but their individual names have been mentioned by the issue's writer Ryan K. Lindsay.

characters.name: Braze
characters.description: A zebra who serves as the antagonist of the chapter book Rainbow Dash and the Daring Do Double Dare. His name is an anagram of "zebra".

characters.name: Buttercream Sunday
characters.description: Appears in a rabbit hole on Friends Forever Issue #16 page 10.

characters.name: Cactus Rose
characters.description: An abada who appears in the "Season 10" comics.

characters.name: Cassie
characters.description: A kelpie who appears in Friendship is Magic Issue #23 and hypnotizes the ponies of Ponyville into breaking the Ponyville dam.

characters.name: Cletus
characters.description: Counterparts to both wild and domestic animals are featured throughout Equestria in various episodes. Most of these animals only have incidental roles or appearances. The level of intelligence these animals show can vary, even between members of the same species. Some animals, much like ponies, are also capable of speech or social interaction. In the My Little Pony Friendship Is Magic Season 1 DVD's commentary for Winter Wrap Up, executive Robert Fewkes said "the rule is only the hoofed creatures" can speak in the show (not counting mythological creatures).

characters.name: Cosmos
characters.description: My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #75-Issue #78 villain, a chaos-causing being infatuated with Discord. The Art of My Little Pony: The Movie pages 46, 47, and 155 and Enterplay trading card The Movie #67 feature Tempest Shadow concepts of Cosmos as Celestia's previously-unplanned brother.

characters.name: Cranky Doodle Donkey
characters.description: Cranky Doodle Donkey is a male donkey and Matilda's husband who first appears in the episode A Friend in Deed. His name is a pun on "Yankee Doodle Dandy", a famous song written by George M. Cohan in 1942.

characters.name: Cranky Doodle Ryan
characters.description: A representation of Katie Cook's husband Ryan Wilcox. Appears on Friendship is Magic Issue #1 pages 17 and 19/Hot Topic T-shirt, Micro-Series Issue #10 page 19, Friendship is Magic Issue #41 page 13, and Friendship is Magic Issue #50 page 20.

characters.name: Crystal
characters.description: A kelpie who appears in the "Season 10" comics.

characters.name: Discord
characters.description: Discord is a male draconequus and former antagonist introduced in the season two premiere. Princess Celestia explains that Discord is the spirit of chaos and disharmony who once ruled over Equestria in a state of unrest and unhappiness, until she and Princess Luna used the Elements of Harmony to imprison him in stone. However, after the sisters lost their connection to the Elements, the spell was broken and Discord broke free. Later in the series, Princess Celestia decides that Discord should be reformed so his magic can be used for good.

characters.name: Sir Discord
characters.description: An alternate universe counterpart of Discord, who uses the superhero identity "Captain Goodguy." Stated by the alternate King Sombra in Issue #19 to be looking after the Equestrian northlands.

characters.name: Doran
characters.description: A troublesome Nyx who befriends Nightmare Moon and is later turned into one of the Nightmare forces.

characters.name: Dust Devil
characters.description: An abada who appears in the "Season 10" comics.

characters.name: Princess Eris
characters.description: Appears in My Little Pony: Nightmare Knights as a casino owner, Goddess of Luck, and the Lord of Chaos in an alternate Equestria. Stated to be Discord's cousin. Princess Eris is a character in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss during the Nightmare Knights and "Reflections of Harmony" events. Her in-game bio states "An alternate-universe Lord of Chaos who keeps Daybreaker on a leash....Yeah, it's a long story."

characters.name: Flap
characters.description: In The Festival of Lights.​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Flip
characters.description: In The Festival of Lights.​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Gaea Everfree
characters.description: A vengeful forest spirit who is mentioned throughout and briefly featured in My Little Pony Equestria Girls: Legend of Everfree. According to Ishi Rudell, "Gaea was a spooky story made up by Timber to cover for his sister who was using magic around camp."

characters.name: Gaiman
characters.description: One of the Nyx responsible for giving ponies good dreams. He is later turned into one of the Nightmare Forces by Nightmare Moon.

characters.name: Gram-Gram
characters.description: Lord Tirek's grandmother, mentioned in Frenemies.

characters.name: Grogar
characters.description: Grogar is a male ram first alluded to in the season seven episode A Flurry of Emotions. He is a magically powerful tyrant who ruled and terrorized Equestria in ancient times. In the ninth and final season, Discord disguises himself as Grogar and forms an alliance of villains in a misguided effort to prepare Twilight Sparkle as Equestria's new ruler.

characters.name: Grubber
characters.description: Grubber is a male pug-faced hedgehog who appears as a minor antagonist in My Little Pony The Movie. He is Tempest Shadow's sidekick and a former servant of the Storm King.

characters.name: Queen Haydon
characters.description: Tirek and Scorpan's mother and the queen of a kingdom far from Equestria.

characters.name: Hubert
characters.description: A Butterdragon and friend of Discord's who lives in prehistoric Equestrian times. Named the same as Avery's human world version and as a swan.

characters.name: Iggy
characters.description: One of three rock lobsters that take Spike and Princess Celestia prisoner in Friends Forever Issue #3. Named the same as a nickname for Igneous Rock Pie.

characters.name: Imp
characters.description: A greater Equestrian mimicker that the Cutie Mark Crusaders befriend in Micro-Series Issue #7. Also appears on the Tidewater Comicon 2018 exclusive cover of My Little Pony: Ponyville Mysteries Issue #1.

characters.name:
The Spider Queen
Insidira
characters.description: In The Festival of Lights.​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Ira
characters.description: One of the umbrum and Rabia's daughter in Siege of the Crystal Empire.

characters.name: Iron Will
characters.description: Iron Will is a male minotaur and supporting character who first appears in the season two episode Putting Your Hoof Down. He travels around Equestria, holding assertiveness seminars. He has a habit of referring to himself in the third person and using various, often rhyming, catchphrases, such as, "When somepony tries to block, show them that you rock!"

characters.name: Jerome
characters.description: Larry's bumbling subordinate. Also appears in FIENDship is Magic Issue #4. A squirrel of the same name is mentioned in The Mean 6.

characters.name: Jim
characters.description: A large troll living in a cave in the Appaloosan Mountains. A collector of assorted, crudely-made memorabilia. [1]​[​specify​]​ Also appears on a poster in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #61.

characters.name: Larry
characters.description: Larry, or "Shadowfright" as he first prefers to be called, is a secondary antagonist in the second arc of the comic series. He is the leader of the Nightmare Forces/Dark Forces, a race of dark shadowy creatures that resemble ghosts and create nightmares. He appears only in the comics. The name Larry is a diminutive version of the name Lawrence.

characters.name: King Leo
characters.description: He appears in the story book Under the Sparkling Sea. He is the ruler of Aquastria and a cousin of Princess Celestia. Similar to Léon in name and Celestia-cousinship. Human world Leo appears in Wondercolts Forever: The Diary of Celestia and Luna.

characters.name: Marini
characters.description: A zebra who appears in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #89.

characters.name: Matilda
characters.description: Matilda is a female donkey and Cranky Doodle Donkey's wife who first appears in the episode A Friend in Deed. She has a brown coat and a curly dark-brown mane.

characters.name: Medley Brook
characters.description: A kelpie who appears in the "Season 10" comics.

characters.name: Metty
characters.description: One of three rock lobsters that take Spike and Princess Celestia prisoner in Friends Forever Issue #3.

characters.name: Mulia Mild
characters.description: Mulia Mild is a female mule and a baker who appears in MMMystery on the Friendship Express and Equestria Games. Her name and appearance are references to real-life chef Julia Child, the same basis as S06E12 Unnamed Unicorn Mare #5. The fact that mousse is French in origin may also be a reference, as Julia Child is known for popularizing French cuisine in America.

characters.name: Nar Wally
characters.description: He appears in the story book Under the Sparkling Sea. He helps Arrow get out of a sinkhole and teaches Rainbow Dash for the contest.

characters.name: Nutso
characters.description: A friend of Angel's who appears in Friends Forever Issue #5.

characters.name: Pepper Clark
characters.description: Appears depicted in a drawing on Friends Forever Issue #16 page 2.

characters.name: Pink Bunny
characters.description: A friend of Angel's mentioned in Friends Forever Issue #5.

characters.name: Queen of the Hippos
characters.description: Mentioned in and appears during the animated closing credits of My Little Pony The Movie.

characters.name: Rabia
characters.description: One of the umbrum in Siege of the Crystal Empire. She is a character called "True Umbrum" in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss during the Siege of the Crystal Empire and "Reflections of Harmony" events. Her in-game description states, "The closest thing Equestria has to a brain-melting, transdimensional nightmare. Paging H. Pony Lovecart!"

characters.name: Ralph
characters.description: One of the Storm King's troops in My Little Pony: The Movie Prequel Issue #2. Shares his name with one of Princess Luna's royal guards.

characters.name: Runt
characters.description: Big Boy and Runt are two gremlins who first appear in My Little Pony Micro-Series Issue #2 as antagonists and later cameo in other IDW comics. They are referred to only as gremlins in their debut issue and as cloud gremlins in the publicity summary of the issue, but their individual names have been mentioned by the issue's writer Ryan K. Lindsay.

characters.name: Sable
characters.description: In The Festival of Lights.​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Sam
characters.description: One of the Storm King's troops in My Little Pony: The Movie Prequel Issue #2. Shares his name with one of Princess Celestia's royal guards and a cat.

characters.name: Saturn
characters.description: A talking planet that appears in Pinkie Pie's fantasy sequence in Sparkle's Seven. Voiced by Brian Drummond.

characters.name: Scorpan
characters.description: Scorpan is a male gargoyle prince and Lord Tirek's younger brother who appears in the IDW comics and is alluded to in the season four finale, My Little Pony Best Gift Ever, and A Trivial Pursuit.

characters.name: Seddy
characters.description: One of three rock lobsters that take Spike and Princess Celestia prisoner in Friends Forever Issue #3.

characters.name: Sendak the Elder
characters.description: A centaur hermit who teaches Tirek in the ways of magic.

characters.name: Senior Huevos
characters.description: A sock puppet that appears in Make New Friends but Keep Discord, in an alternate dimension that Discord rips open a path to at the Grand Galloping Gala. Built, performed, and named by Jayson Thiessen.

characters.name: Skellinore
characters.description: A Level 18 Bone Warrior in Squizard's mage army in Ogres & Oubliettes in The Break Up Break Down.

characters.name: The Smooze
characters.description: The Smooze is a slime creature who first appears in the season five episode Make New Friends but Keep Discord. He is Discord's friend and guest to the Grand Galloping Gala. Though Discord mentions that the Smooze is genderless, he is often addressed with male pronouns.

characters.name: Sonata Dusk
characters.description: Sonata Dusk is a female siren and one of the main antagonists in My Little Pony Equestria Girls: Rainbow Rocks. She is a backup singer in her band the Dazzlings, rivaling the Rainbooms.

characters.name: Spirit of Hearth's Warming Past
characters.description: Appears in A Hearth's Warming Tail as a character in the story "A Hearth's Warming Tale". Shares her depiction with Applejack. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Spirit of Hearth's Warming Presents
characters.description: Appears in A Hearth's Warming Tail as a character in the story "A Hearth's Warming Tale". Shares her depiction with Pinkie Pie. She is a character in Gameloft's mobile game. She also appears in Baby Flurry Heart's Heartfelt Scrapbook episode 7.

characters.name: Spirit of Hearth's Warming Yet to Come
characters.description: Appears in A Hearth's Warming Tail as a character in the story "A Hearth's Warming Tale". Depicted as Princess Luna in Twilight Sparkle's imagining of the story. Enterplay collectible card game Defenders of Equestria expansion set card #35 SR of Princess Luna as the Spirit of Hearth's Warming Yet to Come gives her the description "The Spirit of Hearth's Warming Yet to Come had good reason to be so harsh on Snowfall Frost—if the unicorn's plans had come to fruition, the Spirit would have ceased to exist!"

characters.name: Spryyg
characters.description: In The Festival of Lights.​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Squizard
characters.description: An evil wizard in the role-playing game Ogres & Oubliettes in Dungeons & Discords. Voiced by Peter New.

characters.name: Steven Magnet
characters.description: Steven Magnet is a male sea serpent who first appears in the episode Friendship is Magic, part 2. He was first named in merchandise, and later named in the season five episode Slice of Life, in which he is credited as "Stephen Magnet".

characters.name: The Storm King
characters.description: The Storm King is a male satyr-like creature who appears as the main antagonist of My Little Pony The Movie. He is a conqueror of lands beyond Equestria who launches an invasion of Canterlot and seeks the magic of the four Alicorn princesses to take over the world. He is defeated by the Mane Six and his former lieutenant Tempest Shadow, turned to stone, and shattered to pieces.

characters.name: Strife
characters.description: The Storm King's original second-in-command in My Little Pony: The Movie Prequel Issues #1 and #2.

characters.name: Lord Tirek
characters.description: Lord Tirek is a male centaur, the older brother of Scorpan, the main antagonist of the season four finale, and one of the main antagonists of the season nine finale. He is a villain who escapes from Tartarus, steals magic, and seeks to rule over Equestria.

characters.name: Tree of Harmony
characters.description: The Tree of Harmony was a magical tree that held the Elements of Harmony. It was located in the Cave of Harmony in the Everfree Forest, near Princess Celestia and Princess Luna's old castle. The center of the tree had a star shaped like Twilight Sparkle's cutie mark, while Celestia and Luna's cutie marks were on the trunk. It was destroyed by King Sombra in The Beginning of the End - Part 1, but then reformed into the "Treehouse of Harmony" in Uprooted.

characters.name: King Vorak
characters.description: Tirek and Scorpan's father and the king of a kingdom far from Equestria. He is mentioned by name in The Ending of the End - Part 2.

characters.name: Webfather
characters.description: In The Festival of Lights.​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Well-to-Do
characters.description: The owner of the Mighty Minotaur Construction company who seeks to build an amusement park on Everfree Forest land in The Root of the Problem. Also listed on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #34 page 3 and appears on My Little Pony: Nightmare Knights Issue #1 page 14. He is a character named "Well-To-Do" in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as an enemy minion during the "Reflections of Harmony" event.

characters.name: Windy
characters.description: The subject of a legend made up by Flim and Flam in the My Little Pony Holiday Special 2017 comic. A windigo said to bring snow to Equestria every year when shown kindness.

characters.name: Zecora
characters.description: Zecora is a female zebra who resides in a hut in the Everfree Forest and first appears in Bridle Gossip. Initially believed to be an evil enchantress by the terrified populace of Ponyville, she later befriends the ponies and frequently helps them out with her knowledge of magical ailments. She speaks with a strong African-esque accent, forming rhyming couplets with all her sentences.

characters.name: Angel
characters.description: Angel, or Angel Bunny, is a male rabbit and Fluttershy's pet. Angel is somewhat spoiled and bossy towards Fluttershy on occasion; however, he does care about her and actually displays an intention to help her stand up for herself. Most of Angel's actions are played simultaneously with instrumental jingles.

characters.name: Angel
characters.description: An alternate universe version of Angel that appears in Friendship is Magic Issue #20.

characters.name: Bloofy
characters.description: Biscuit and Spur's pet Whirling Mungtooth in Growing Up is Hard to Do.

characters.name: Blue Carbunkle
characters.description: One of the competing tortoises in the Great Northern Tortoise Races in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #83.

characters.name: Calvin & Theo
characters.description: One of multiple character designs in "007_c04_baby_chipmunks" under "Critters" from "AssetsLicensor". Appears in Dragonshy, in Stare Master, as Playful Ponies Lulu Luck's pets, on Friendship Express Train track stickers, in Too Many Pinkie Pies, in Magical Mystery Cure, in a promotional image, in Filli Vanilli, in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #23, in Castle Sweet Castle, on a Signature My Little Pony magazine issue 41 sticker, on Enterplay collectible card game Equestrian Odysseys expansion set card #79 U, in a storybook whose Polish title is Nieszczęścia chodzą parami, in The Hooffields and McColts, in MLPEG Friendship Games _Bloopers_, in a storybook whose Polish title is Co w puszczy piszczy, in Fluttershy Leans In, in A Health of Information, in Atlas świata My Little Pony, in the seventh version of the remastered opening sequence, in Fake It 'Til You Make It, in Yakity-Sax, and in Teacher of the Month. Calvin is named the same as a bird.

characters.name: Conan Boil
characters.description: One of the competing tortoises in the Great Northern Tortoise Races in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #83.

characters.name: Copper Beech
characters.description: One of the competing tortoises in the Great Northern Tortoise Races in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #83.

characters.name: Fluffy Bun
characters.description: An unnamed filly's pet bunny who goes missing in Daring Do and the Marked Thief of Marapore.

characters.name: Foo Foo
characters.description: One of Flim and Flam's performing rabbits in Fluttershy and the Fine Furry Friends Fair.

characters.name: Gummy
characters.description: Gummy is a small toothless green alligator who is kept as a pet by Pinkie Pie. He appears in various episodes accompanying Pinkie Pie and is often depicted gumming her. He is called Gummy Snap in some merchandise and other media.

characters.name: Harry
characters.description: Harry is a male bear and one of Fluttershy's animal companions. He is first mentioned in Party of One, he makes his first on-screen appearance in Lesson Zero, and he is first addressed by name in Scare Master.

characters.name: Jim
characters.description: Princess Celestia and Luna's pet turtle, mentioned in The Journal of the Two Sisters. [2]​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Mr. Prickly
characters.description: Fluttershy's pet spider in My Little Pony: The Manga - A Day in the Life of Equestria Vol. 1.

characters.name: Puddles
characters.description: Cuppa Joe's pet fish in the My Little Pony Holiday Special 2015 comic. Named like G1 Puddles.

characters.name: Quincy
characters.description: Discord's pet clownfish in Discord and the Ponyville Players Dramarama. Named the same as a human world sea turtle.

characters.name: Rupert
characters.description: One of Fluttershy's animal companions. Appears in Winter Wrap Up, in Party Pooped, in MLPEG Friendship Games _Bloopers_, on Enterplay collectible card game Marks in Time expansion set card #50 R, in Fluttershy Leans In, in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #54, and in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Scarlet Study
characters.description: Alder Brown's pet tortoise in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #83.

characters.name: Silver Blaze
characters.description: Downey Burn's pet tortoise in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #83.

characters.name: Stingy-McScorpion
characters.description: One of Doc Holstein's pets in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #25.

characters.name: Tank
characters.description: Tank is a male tortoise who is first introduced in May the Best Pet Win! By the end of the episode, he becomes Rainbow Dash's pet and the first pet to be introduced in the second season.

characters.name: Tank
characters.description: An alternate universe version of Tank who appears in the mini-comic included with Friendship is Magic Issue #20.

characters.name: Tiberius
characters.description: Princess Luna's pet opossum in My Little Pony Micro-Series Issue #10. Also appears in Friendship is Magic Issue #17, Issue #20, and Issue #65, My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #7 and Issue #38, and Princess Luna and the Festival of the Winter Moon.

characters.name: Tiberius
characters.description: An alternate universe counterpart of Tiberius who appears in Friendship is Magic Issue #19.

characters.name: Toby
characters.description: Fluttershy's pet fruit bat who appears in the chapter book Twilight Sparkle and the Crystal Heart Spell.

characters.name: William Wormsworth
characters.description: Fluttershy's pet inchworm, whom she describes as a "bookworm." Accompanies her to the Golden Oak Library Society's first meeting in Rainbow Dash and the Daring Do Double Dare.

characters.name: Antoine
characters.description: One of the animals at Fluttershy's Sweet Feather Sanctuary. Named in She Talks to Angel.

characters.name: Mr. Beaverton Beaverteeth
characters.description: Counterparts to both wild and domestic animals are featured throughout Equestria in various episodes. Most of these animals only have incidental roles or appearances. The level of intelligence these animals show can vary, even between members of the same species. Some animals, much like ponies, are also capable of speech or social interaction. In the My Little Pony Friendship Is Magic Season 1 DVD's commentary for Winter Wrap Up, executive Robert Fewkes said "the rule is only the hoofed creatures" can speak in the show (not counting mythological creatures).

characters.name: Bernard Rabbit
characters.description: A bunny rabbit featured in Trapeze Star's magic acrobatic act in Ponet Fantastique in Viva Las Pegasus. He also appears in Rarity's Peek Behind the Boutique Ep. 1 Fashion Do's and Don'ts. Shares his design with Angel. Voiced by Andrea Libman.

characters.name: Bertha
characters.description: Counterparts to both wild and domestic animals are featured throughout Equestria in various episodes. Most of these animals only have incidental roles or appearances. The level of intelligence these animals show can vary, even between members of the same species. Some animals, much like ponies, are also capable of speech or social interaction. In the My Little Pony Friendship Is Magic Season 1 DVD's commentary for Winter Wrap Up, executive Robert Fewkes said "the rule is only the hoofed creatures" can speak in the show (not counting mythological creatures).

characters.name: Mr. Bouncy
characters.description: Counterparts to both wild and domestic animals are featured throughout Equestria in various episodes. Most of these animals only have incidental roles or appearances. The level of intelligence these animals show can vary, even between members of the same species. Some animals, much like ponies, are also capable of speech or social interaction. In the My Little Pony Friendship Is Magic Season 1 DVD's commentary for Winter Wrap Up, executive Robert Fewkes said "the rule is only the hoofed creatures" can speak in the show (not counting mythological creatures).

characters.name: Bruce the Shark
characters.description: The Amazing Sea Show featuree on My Little Pony Micro-Series Issue #10 page 19; one of Fluttershy's sanctuary animals on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #64 page 16. Named after the animatronic shark used in the 1975 film Jaws.

characters.name: Brunella
characters.description: A hippo in Friendship is Magic Issue #1 with the same mane style and bow as Apple Bloom.

characters.name: Carol
characters.description: A blue crab living on the outskirts of Seaquestria in Beyond Equestria: Fluttershy Balances the Scales.

characters.name: Clarissa
characters.description: Counterparts to both wild and domestic animals are featured throughout Equestria in various episodes. Most of these animals only have incidental roles or appearances. The level of intelligence these animals show can vary, even between members of the same species. Some animals, much like ponies, are also capable of speech or social interaction. In the My Little Pony Friendship Is Magic Season 1 DVD's commentary for Winter Wrap Up, executive Robert Fewkes said "the rule is only the hoofed creatures" can speak in the show (not counting mythological creatures).

characters.name: Clementine
characters.description: A giraffe who appears in Fluttershy Leans In, the seventh version of the remastered opening sequence, Yakity-Sax, She Talks to Angel, Teacher of the Month, My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #70, and Issue #73. Called "Clementine" by Gillian M. Berrow, who wanted to name her "Creamsicle"—after G1 Creamsicle—which didn't clear. Officially named in She Talks to Angel.

characters.name: Dolores
characters.description: A giant rhino mentioned by Discord in The Big Mac Question.

characters.name: F'wuffy
characters.description: A giant tarantula that attacks the Mane 6 as they're traveling through a cave in the Appaloosan mountains. He is defeated when Jim "adopts" and names him after Pinkie Pie claims he's a teddy bear. Named like Fluffy and Mr. Fluffy.

characters.name: Fuzzy Legs
characters.description: Spider design used in Maud Pie, Enterplay collectible card game The Crystal Games #152 U Stone Cold, and Scare Master (named).

characters.name: Gil
characters.description: A fish that Fluttershy nurses back to health in My Little Pirate: Friendship Ahoy.

characters.name: Mr. Gossamer
characters.description: One of Fluttershy's butterfly friends in Ponies of Dark Water. Named like G3 dragonfly Gossamer.

characters.name: Harry
characters.description: A rainbow starfish living on the outskirts of Seaquestria in Beyond Equestria: Fluttershy Balances the Scales. Shares his names with Harry the bear.

characters.name: Jamal
characters.description: Counterparts to both wild and domestic animals are featured throughout Equestria in various episodes. Most of these animals only have incidental roles or appearances. The level of intelligence these animals show can vary, even between members of the same species. Some animals, much like ponies, are also capable of speech or social interaction. In the My Little Pony Friendship Is Magic Season 1 DVD's commentary for Winter Wrap Up, executive Robert Fewkes said "the rule is only the hoofed creatures" can speak in the show (not counting mythological creatures).

characters.name: June
characters.description: A blue crab living on the outskirts of Seaquestria in Beyond Equestria: Fluttershy Balances the Scales. Earlier addressed by Discord via intercom in Dungeons & Discords; tweeted about by Jim Miller between then and Fluttershy Balances the Scales.

characters.name: Lola
characters.description: One of Dr. Fauna's animal patients in Fluttershy Leans In who originates from Western Equestria.

characters.name: Mr. Mousey
characters.description: Counterparts to both wild and domestic animals are featured throughout Equestria in various episodes. Most of these animals only have incidental roles or appearances. The level of intelligence these animals show can vary, even between members of the same species. Some animals, much like ponies, are also capable of speech or social interaction. In the My Little Pony Friendship Is Magic Season 1 DVD's commentary for Winter Wrap Up, executive Robert Fewkes said "the rule is only the hoofed creatures" can speak in the show (not counting mythological creatures).

characters.name: Muriel
characters.description: One of the animals at Fluttershy's Sweet Feather Sanctuary in She Talks to Angel.

characters.name: Piggington
characters.description: Counterparts to both wild and domestic animals are featured throughout Equestria in various episodes. Most of these animals only have incidental roles or appearances. The level of intelligence these animals show can vary, even between members of the same species. Some animals, much like ponies, are also capable of speech or social interaction. In the My Little Pony Friendship Is Magic Season 1 DVD's commentary for Winter Wrap Up, executive Robert Fewkes said "the rule is only the hoofed creatures" can speak in the show (not counting mythological creatures).

characters.name: Scout
characters.description: One of the animals at Fluttershy's Sweet Feather Sanctuary. Named in She Talks to Angel.

characters.name: Smoky
characters.description: A family of raccoons consisting of at least patriarch Smoky, matriarch Softpad, and child Smoky Jr. appears in the series and the My Little Pony Equestria Girls franchise. They first appear in the season six episode The Saddle Row Review.

characters.name: Smoky Jr.
characters.description: A family of raccoons consisting of at least patriarch Smoky, matriarch Softpad, and child Smoky Jr. appears in the series and the My Little Pony Equestria Girls franchise. They first appear in the season six episode The Saddle Row Review.

characters.name: Softpad
characters.description: A family of raccoons consisting of at least patriarch Smoky, matriarch Softpad, and child Smoky Jr. appears in the series and the My Little Pony Equestria Girls franchise. They first appear in the season six episode The Saddle Row Review.

characters.name: Spindle
characters.description: Spider design used in Read It and Weep (multiple; one voiced via "Fuzzy Slippers" by Brian Drummond), an Enterplay trading card binder back, School Daze - Part 1, and What Lies Beneath (multiple; one named).

characters.name: B​[​specify​]​
characters.description: In Judge Not by the Cover.​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Bad Apple
characters.description: An apple given life due to remnants of Nightmare Moon's magic and the main antagonist of Night of the Living Apples. Also appears on My Little Pony: Nightmare Knights Issue #1 page 13 and Issue #3 page 2. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name: Miss Buffy
characters.description: A Nyx that Fluttershy adopts and names in Friendship is Magic Issue #7. Appears to resemble a rabbit. Named like Buffy.

characters.name: Cyclops-clops
characters.description: A fictional monster from the Homare book The Ponyssey brought to life by Shadow Lock in Issue #52. Has a similar body shape and color scheme to Bulk Biceps. Its cutie mark is an eyeball. He is a character named "Cyclops-Clops" in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss with a story role during the "Nightmare Night at the Museum" event. His bio states, "'Hear me, o Sirens who swim in the seas, bright-maned! If truly I am your kin, grant that Ponysseus of Maretonia may never reach her home again!'"

characters.name: Dea
characters.description: In Judge Not by the Cover.​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Edith
characters.description: A cockatrice that helps Silverstream with her research project in Student Counsel.

characters.name: Frankenstag's monster
characters.description: A fictional monster from the Marey Spelley book Frakenstag first mentioned in My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #51 and brought to life by Shadow Lock in Issue #52. He is a character named "Frankenstag's Monster" in Gameloft's mobile game, and serves as a boss battle helper during the "Nightmare Night at the Museum" event. His bio states "'The fallen Nyx becomes a malignant Nightmare. Yet even those enemies of Celestia and ponykind have friends and associates in their desolation. I am alone.'"

characters.name: Good Apple
characters.description: An apple given life due to remnants of Nightmare Moon's magic who offers to help the Mane Six save Ponyville from the evil apples in Night of the Living Apples. He is a character in Gameloft's mobile game; his bio states, "Most green apples are tarter than the red variety -- but this apple is a LOT sweeter! Also, he has glasses for some reason."

characters.name: Housey
characters.description: A house made magical by Miasmo in My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #34.

characters.name: Mr. Jackalope
characters.description: Appears together with Well-to-Do in the stomach of a hydra in Friendship is Magic Issue #28.

characters.name: Manny Roar
characters.description:
My Little Pony Friendship is Magic hosts an array of creatures that have a counterpart in both mythology and fantasy, some of which are far more removed from their realistic counterpart than usual animals.

A few creatures, like dragons and Diamond Dogs, have speaking roles and display sapience when interacting with the protagonists. Others behave more like animals and neither speak nor display sapience. While most beings are from real-life known myths and legends, others are completely original and made up for the show, such as breezies.

characters.name: Melvin
characters.description: A manticore who appears in The Journal of the Two Sisters. He attacks the princesses, but after he is defeated, he becomes a friend and helps in the construction of the Castle of the Royal Pony Sisters. Also mentioned in My Little Pony: Friends Forever Issue #35.

characters.name: Smartyhoof
characters.description: A peryton that Sweetie Belle first encounters and names in Ponyville Mysteries: Peryton Panic. Also featured in Ponyville Mysteries: Journey to the Livewood.

characters.name: Snowbutt McTwinkles
characters.description: Appears in Party Pooped. Designed and named by Kora Kosicka.

characters.name: Sporedust Butterfly
characters.description: In The Festival of Lights.​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Mr. Tortoise-Snap
characters.description: Appears in Between Dark and Dawn. "We pull from mythology a lot and there’s many giant turtles there."​[​specify​]​

characters.name: Bloomberg
characters.description: the series are not sentient creatures, and most are not even living things, and they mostly play a part as characters only in other characters' minds. This article covers the more prominent non-sentient characters.

characters.name: S01E01 Unnamed Sun
characters.description: The sun managed by Princess Celestia. Its face, usually unshown, is visible on Friendship is Magic Issue #41 cover RI and is depicted via map, portrait, and stage backdrop drawings in On Your Marks.

characters.name: S01E06 Unnamed Ursa Major
characters.description:
My Little Pony Friendship is Magic hosts an array of creatures that have a counterpart in both mythology and fantasy, some of which are far more removed from their realistic counterpart than usual animals.

A few creatures, like dragons and Diamond Dogs, have speaking roles and display sapience when interacting with the protagonists. Others behave more like animals and neither speak nor display sapience. While most beings are from real-life known myths and legends, others are completely original and made up for the show, such as breezies.

characters.name: S02E07 Unnamed Ladybug
characters.description: Ladybug design used in May the Best Pet Win!, Ponyville Confidential, My Little Pony Equestria Girls, It Ain't Easy Being Breezies, My Little Pony Equestria Girls: Rainbow Rocks, Bloom & Gloom, My Little Pony Equestria Girls: Friendship Games, and Starlight the Hypnotist. A mostly-recolored version is Applejack's ladybug friend in Fluttershy & Starlight Glimmer Pet Care Class toys.

characters.name:
Willful Lighting Tech
S02E19 Unnamed Goat #1
characters.description: Appears in Putting Your Hoof Down on Iron Will's team, appears on the Season 2 poster behind Iron Will, is indirectly mentioned on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #34 page 3 as having left Iron Will, appears in Once Upon a Zeppelin back on Iron Will's team, and is a character called "Willful Lighting Tech" in Gameloft's mobile game.

characters.name:
Willful Stage Manager
S02E19 Unnamed Goat #2
characters.description: Appears in Putting Your Hoof Down on Iron Will's team, appears on the Season 2 poster behind Iron Will, is indirectly mentioned on My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic Issue #34 page 3 as having left Iron Will, appears in Once Upon a Zeppelin back on Iron Will's team, is a character called "Willful Stage Manager" in Gameloft's mobile game, and appears in Between Dark and Dawn. Shares his design with S04E11 Unnamed Goat and S07E22 Unnamed Goat.

characters.name: S03E04 Unnamed Movie Character #1
characters.description: Appears in One Bad Apple and on Enterplay collectible card game Absolute Discord expansion set card #156 R.

characters.name: S03E04 Unnamed Movie Character #2
characters.description: Appears in One Bad Apple.

characters.name: S03E04 Unnamed Movie Character #3
characters.description: Appears in One Bad Apple and on Enterplay collectible card game Absolute Discord expansion set card #156 R.

characters.name: S03E04 Unnamed Movie Character #4
characters.description: Appears in One Bad Apple and on Enterplay collectible card game Absolute Discord expansion set card #156 R.

characters.name: S04E17 Unnamed Chimera
characters.description:
My Little Pony Friendship is Magic hosts an array of creatures that have a counterpart in both mythology and fantasy, some of which are far more removed from their realistic counterpart than usual animals.

A few creatures, like dragons and Diamond Dogs, have speaking roles and display sapience when interacting with the protagonists. Others behave more like animals and neither speak nor display sapience. While most beings are from real-life known myths and legends, others are completely original and made up for the show, such as breezies.

characters.name: Tim Packford
characters.description: Appears during an extremely brief shot in Slice of Life. Tweeted by Jim Miller in mid-June 2015. Played by Timothy Packford.

characters.name: Jim
characters.description: Appears during an extremely brief shot in Slice of Life. Tweeted by Sabrina Alberghetti, Ishi Rudell, and Jim Miller respectively on May 27, 2013, on April 3, 2014, and in mid-June 2015. Played by Jim Miller.

characters.name: Lunchie
characters.description: Appears during an extremely brief shot in Slice of Life. Tweeted by Katrina Hadley and Jim Miller respectively on September 25, 2014 and in mid-June 2015. Played by Katrina Hadley.

characters.name: Jayson
characters.description: Appears during an extremely brief shot in Slice of Life. Tweeted by Sabrina Alberghetti, Ishi Rudell, and Jim Miller respectively on May 27, 2013, on April 3, 2014, and in mid-June 2015. Played by Jayson Thiessen.

characters.name: Ishi
characters.description: Appears during an extremely brief shot in Slice of Life. Tweeted by Ishi Rudell and Jim Miller respectively on April 3, 2014 and in mid-June 2015. Played by Ishi Rudell.

characters.name: S06E05 Unnamed Slingtail
characters.description: Appears in Gauntlet of Fire several times as an obstacle in the Gauntlet of Fire.

characters.name:
Sphinx
S07E18 Unnamed Sphinx
characters.description: Appears in Daring Done? and is a character called "Sphinx" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of her states, "Hobbies include riddles, long walks inside her pyramid, and menacing Southern Equestria." She has a story role and serves as a boss in the "Wonderbolt for a Day" event.

characters.name: Micro 06 Unnamed Sass Squash
characters.description:
My Little Pony Friendship is Magic hosts an array of creatures that have a counterpart in both mythology and fantasy, some of which are far more removed from their realistic counterpart than usual animals.

A few creatures, like dragons and Diamond Dogs, have speaking roles and display sapience when interacting with the protagonists. Others behave more like animals and neither speak nor display sapience. While most beings are from real-life known myths and legends, others are completely original and made up for the show, such as breezies.

characters.name: Micro 07 Unnamed Greater Equestrian Mimicker - Imp's Mother
characters.description: Appears at the end of My Little Pony Micro-Series Issue #7.

characters.name: Friends Forever 04 Unnamed Crystal Bard
characters.description: A crystal bard that is mistaken for a crystal ghost in Friends Forever Issue #4.

characters.name:
Storm Creature General
​[​specify​]​
characters.description: A character called "Storm Creature General" in Gameloft's mobile game. Serves as commander of the Storm Creatures occupying Ponyville during the "Resistance Rising" event.

characters.name:
Reformed Windigo
​[​specify​]​
characters.description: A character called "Reformed Windigo" in Gameloft's mobile game. The game's description of Reformed Windigo states, "These fierce legendary beasts were indirectly responsible for Hearth's Warming Eve! This one, though, runs on the power of friendship instead of resentment, and is 99% guaranteed to not cause a time paradox."
